summary.name: Vinyl record
summary.description: The media object I have chosen is a vinyl record. In particular, the album I picked was Dayglow's 2019 debut Fuzzybrain.

overview.name: PVC (polyvinyl chlorate)
overview.description: This is the main component of vinyl record making. It is sourced in Bangkok, at the Thai Plastic and Chemicals Headquarters.

location.address: Thai Plastic and Chemicals, M4XR+GQ7, Mueang Rayong District, Rayong 21150, Thailand

overview.name: Carbon/graphite
overview.description: Carbon is what makes black vinyl black. With most records produced in black, carbon is a major mineral component of them. Yunshan Mine in China.

location.address: HRHM+GQ8, Jianshe St, Luobei County, Hegang, Heilongjiang, China, 154200

overview.name: Carbon/graphite
overview.description: (see node 2), Mozambique is another major country for graphite mining. Twigg Mining and Exploration Co.

overview.name: Carbon/graphite
overview.description: (see node 2), Mozambique is another major country for graphite mining. GK Ancuabe Graphite Mine SA

overview.name: Nickel
overview.description: Records are submerged in a nickel plating solution for sealing after the master disk is carved, made from iron ore. Carajás Mine in Brazil.

location.address: Serra Norte Mining Complex, Parauapebas - State of Pará, 68515-000, Brazil
Bryan Mound Strategic Petroleum Reserve, Freeport, TX 77541

overview.name: Halite/chlorine
overview.description: Chlorine is used in vinyl and makes up about half (57%) of the solution for PVC; the other rough half is carbon. Halite is the main mineral found in chlorine.

overview.name: Halite/chlorine
overview.description: Chlorine is used in vinyl and makes up about half (57%) of the solution for PVC; the other rough half is carbon. Halite is the main mineral found in chlorine.

location.address: PCA Mine, Carlsbad Potash Mining District, Eddy County, New Mexico, USA

overview.name: Ethylyne
overview.description: Ethylyne has historically been made from petroleum. Oil is heated and the gas that is released is sent to processing plants. Plants in the U.S. are found along the Gulf Coast, sensibly near to petroleum reserves. Indorama Ventures is one plant in Louisiana. Environmental efforts in the music industry have been urging a transition to natural gas.

overview.name: Pressing plant
overview.description: After further research, I found that Dayglow, while still acting under their independent label "Very Nice Records," is also partnered with Endel and Sony Music, who pressed with Blue Sprocket Pressing for vinyl production.

location.address: 1594 S Main St, Suite 150, Harrisonburg, VA 22801

overview.name: Pressing plant
overview.description: Dayglow is also signed under Sony Music Publishing. Beyond their U.S. affiliates, Sony began internally pressing records again after a decades-long hiatus in 2018 in Japan.

location.address: 9 Chome-6-35 Akasaka, Minato City, Tokyo 107-0052, Japan

overview.name: Cardboard outer sleeve
overview.description: Various cardboard plants in the U.S.; Archer produces disks themselves along with jackets and inserts.

location.address: Archer Record Pressing Co., 7401 E Davison St, Detroit, MI 48212

overview.name: Inner disk sleeve
overview.description: XPress 360 produces CD/disk sleeves and supplemental materials (lyric sheets, posters, etc.) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BHyWvKuVuqQ

location.address: XPress 360, 4000 Bethel Ave Building 2, Indianapolis, IN 46203

overview.name: Distribution center
overview.description: Alliance accounts for roughly half of the industry's vinyl sales. (Headquartered in Sunrise, FL and warehoused in Shepherdsville, KY.)

overview.name: Independent record store
overview.description: Josey Records in Dallas, TX sources from collectors directly. The resale community of vinyl is one that keeps supply circulating after initial retail purchase.

location.address: 2821 Lyndon B Johnson Fwy #100, Farmers Branch, TX 75234

overview.name: Large retailer, Barnes and Noble
overview.description: Barnes and Noble distributes all of its products beyond vinyl (books, DVDs, etc.) in varying distribution warehouses in NJ and NV.

overview.name: Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Museum Store
overview.description: As shown in my consumption ethnography and described in my supply interview, this museum store sells a variety of vinyl records from both inductees and modern artists. Mike Sumser, the store's multimedia supervisor, informed me that the store sources from Alliance like many other vinyl retailers.
